content.title: Financial Assistance for Registered Fishermen Society
content.details: Financial Assistance for Registered Fishermen Society is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, the fisheries co-operative societies/associations registered with the Fisheries Co-operative Societies, having more than 25 members, will be eligible for financial assistance to the extent of ₹50,000 as a grant-in-aid. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: Financial assistance to the extent of ₹50,000 as a grant-in-aid.
eligibility: The applicant should be fisheries co-operative societies/associations registered with the Fisheries Co-operative Societies.
The society should produce an audited statement of accounts.
The society should employ at least one personnel for the maintenance of records.
The society's books of accounts shall be produced before department authorities for inspection when called for.
The society should have more than 25 members.
content.application_process: Offline. Step 1: The interested applicant should request the prescribed format of the application form from the department. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521, or to the official posted at BDO Office/ Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.
documents_required: Audit statement of the last year.

faqs.question: Can the department authorities refuse inspection of society accounts?
faqs.answer: No, the society's books of accounts shall be produced for inspection when called for.

faqs.question: Is there a specific timeframe for the submission of the application form?
faqs.answer: There is no specific timeframe mentioned for submission.

faqs.question: Can the application form be submitted to BDO Office/ Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries?
faqs.answer: Yes, the form can be submitted to the official posted at BDO Office/ Sub-Offices.

faqs.question: What is the official email address for lodging complaints or grievances?
faqs.answer: Complaints can be lodged at dir-fish.goa@nic.in.

faqs.question: How can grievances or complaints regarding the scheme be addressed?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be registered with the Grievance Redressal Officer or emailed to dir-fish.goa@nic.in, with a response within 30 days.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under the scheme, and who is eligible?
faqs.answer: ₹50,000 is granted as financial assistance to fisheries co-operative societies/associations registered with more than 25 members.
